info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 5 at 2:58PM AKST until November 6 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. Blowing snow reducing visibility to 1/2 mile or less at times.
* WHERE...Thompson Pass.
* WHEN...From 3 AM to 6 PM AKST Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Visibilities reduced to one half mile or less due to blowing snow. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Ongoing snowfall and gusty winds to intensify tonight, developing blowing snow conditions by Thursday morning. Peak wind speeds are expected early Thursday afternoon, but snowfall rates will begin to decline later Thursday afternoon, leading to lower blowing snow potential.
info.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 6 PM AKST THURSDAY
